data.title: Charles Andrew Bates
data.meta_description: Charles Andrew Bates is a former developer and current freelance author and illustrator who contributed to White Wolf and its subsidiaries and imprints Arthaus and Sword & Sorcery, as well as to other companies in the industry. He was managing editor of Sword & Sorcery from 2002–2004. He went by...
data.text:
Charles Andrew Bates is a former developer and current freelance author and illustrator who contributed to White Wolf and its subsidiaries and imprints Arthaus and Sword & Sorcery, as well as to other companies in the industry. He was managing editor of Sword & Sorcery from 2002–2004.

He went by his middle name (Andrew) professionally until 2005. He now uses his full name, Charles Andrew Bates, in credits -- though he signs illustrations simply as "Bates" and apparently prefers that or "Charlie" in daily life. There is no clear reason as to the name changes, other than personal preference.

See his artwork for the World of Darkness.

His web site is a portfolio of past work and samples.

His official contributions for White Wolf include the following:

Special Thanks[]

2000/June: : White Wolf Hockey Special Thanks: Andrew “Robo-D” Bates (#6, Defense). “What’s your name, Defenseman?” “BATES.”

2000/May: : White Wolf Hockey Special Thanks: Andrew “Chrome Dome” Bates (#6, Defense), for distracting the other team with something shiny while everyone else tries to score.

1999/March: : Andrew “Why are you talking?” Bates, for making me feel like a part of the family.

1998/December: : Andrew “Kill. Me. Now.” Bates, for still not being able to avoid the office for even a day.

1998/September: : Andrew “Quanta-Serum” Bates, for revealing that there’s a little World War II supervillain in all of us.

1998/May:

1998/January: : Andrew "Geneva Convention" Bates, for sending our crew packing.

1998: : Andrew “I’d Love to Go, Really...” Bates, for at least having a decent excuse for not going to WorldCon.

1997/December: : Andrew “B.B. Hood” Bates, for takin’ it to the Geneva Convention with lotsa ordnance.

1997/June: : Andrew “Demon Teddy Bear” Bates, for taking care of my cat while I was at NanCon.

1996/October: : Andrew "Outta the Frying Pan" Bates, for being Exiled to E&D. Congrats, you psycho SOB.

1996/July: : Andrew “Oops” Bates, for letting people know that he can draw and not predicting the consequences.

1996/July: VTM/ : Andrew “Friday? Monday? At Some Point?” Bates, for getting his vampiric kid brother into all sorts of trouble.

1996: : Andrew "Cuddles" Bates, for going into Exile.

1996: : Andrew "Renaissance Man" Bates. He sells, he draws, he writes, he interviews, he sings — and those are only the talents I can print.

1996: : Andrew “Carpenter” Bates, for not trusting the Bums of Fate.
